1.name: The Big Lebowski
1.description: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

2.name: Saving Private Ryan
2.description: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

3.name: American History X
3.description: A former neo-nazi skinhead tries to prevent his younger brother from going down the same wrong path that he did.

4.name: The Truman Show
4.description: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

5.name: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
5.description: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.

6.name: Mulan
6.description: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

7.name: Blade
7.description: A half-vampire, half-mortal man becomes a protector of the mortal race, while slaying evil vampires.

8.name: Armageddon
8.description: After discovering that an asteroid the size of Texas is going to impact Earth in less than a month, N.A.S.A. recruits a misfit team of deep core drillers to save the planet.

9.name: There's Something About Mary
9.description: A man gets a chance to meet up with his dream girl from high school, even though his date with her back then was a complete disaster.

10.name: Sliding Doors
10.description: A London woman's love life and career both hinge, unknown to her, on whether or not she catches a train. We see it both ways, in parallel.

11.name: The Thin Red Line
11.description: Adaptation of James Jones' autobiographical 1962 novel, focusing on the conflict at Guadalcanal during the second World War.

12.name: The Wedding Singer
12.description: Robbie, a singer, and Julia, a waitress, are both engaged, but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other.

13.name: The Parent Trap
13.description: Identical twins Annie and Hallie, separated at birth and each raised by one of their biological parents, later discover each other for the first time at summer camp and make a plan to bring their wayward parents back together.

14.name: Meet Joe Black
14.description: Death, who takes the form of a young man, asks a media mogul to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth, and in the process, he falls in love with his guide's daughter.

15.name: Wild Things
15.description: A police detective uncovers a conspiracy behind a case involving a high-school guidance counselor when accusations of rape are made against him by two female students.

16.name: Godzilla
16.description: A giant, reptilian monster surfaces, leaving destruction in its wake as it strides into New York City. To stop it, an earthworm scientist, his reporter ex-girlfriend, and other unlikely heroes team up to save their city.

17.name: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
17.description: An oddball journalist and his psychopathic lawyer travel to Las Vegas for a series of psychedelic escapades.

18.name: Elizabeth
18.description: The early years of the reign of Elizabeth I of England and her difficult task of learning what is necessary to be a monarch.

19.name: The Man in the Iron Mask
19.description: The cruel King Louis XIV of France has a secret twin brother who he keeps imprisoned. Can the twin be substituted for the real king?

20.name: The Faculty
20.description: Students suspect that their teachers are aliens after bizarre occurrences.

21.name: Deep Impact
21.description: Unless a comet can be destroyed before colliding with Earth, only those allowed into shelters will survive. Which people will survive?

22.name: Shakespeare in Love
22.description: A young Shakespeare, out of ideas and short of cash, meets his ideal woman and is inspired to write one of his most famous plays.

23.name: The Mask of Zorro
23.description: A young thief, seeking revenge for the death of his brother, is trained by the once great, but aged Zorro, who also pursues vengeance of his own.

24.name: Great Expectations
24.description: Modernization of Charles Dickens classic story finds the hapless Finn as a painter in New York City pursuing his unrequited and haughty childhood love.

25.name: Out of Sight
25.description: A career bank robber breaks out of jail, and shares a moment of mutual attraction with a U.S. Marshal he has kidnapped.

26.name: Psycho
26.description: A young female embezzler arrives at the Bates Motel, which has terrible secrets of its own.

27.name: A Bug's Life
27.description: A misfit ant, looking for "warriors" to save his colony from greedy grasshoppers, recruits a group of bugs that turn out to be an inept circus troupe.

28.name: Rush Hour
28.description: A loyal and dedicated Hong Kong Inspector teams up with a reckless and loudmouthed L.A.P.D. detective to rescue the Chinese Consul's kidnapped daughter, while trying to arrest a dangerous crime lord along the way.

29.name: Can't Hardly Wait
29.description: Multicharacter teenage comedy about high school graduates with different agenda of life on graduation night.

30.name: Dark City
30.description: A man struggles with memories of his past, which includes a wife he cannot remember, and a nightmarish world without a sun.

31.name: Half Baked
31.description: The story of three not so bright men who come up with a series of crazy schemes to get a friend out of jail.

32.name: Practical Magic
32.description: Two witch sisters, raised by their eccentric aunts in a small town, face closed-minded prejudice and a curse which threatens to prevent them ever finding lasting love.

33.name: EverAfter
33.description: Andy Tennant directed this Cinderella variant. The Brothers Grimm arrive at the home of a wealthy Grande Dame (Jeanne Moreau) who speaks of the many legends surrounding the fable of the ...                See full summary »

34.name: You've Got Mail
34.description: Two business rivals who despise each other in real life unwittingly fall in love over the Internet.

35.name: Pleasantville
35.description: Two 1990s teenage siblings find themselves in a 1950s sitcom, where their influence begins to profoundly change that complacent world.

36.name: Antz
36.description: A rather neurotic ant tries to break from his totalitarian society while trying to win the affection of the princess he loves.

37.name: Ronin
37.description: A freelancing former U.S. Intelligence Agent tries to track down a mysterious package that is wanted by the Irish and the Russians.

38.name: The Waterboy
38.description: A waterboy for a college football team discovers he has a unique tackling ability and becomes a member of the team.

39.name: Velvet Goldmine
39.description: In 1984, British journalist Arthur Stuart investigates the career of 1970s glam superstar Brian Slade, who was heavily influenced in his early years by hard-living and rebellious American singer Curt Wild.

40.name: Following
40.description: A young writer who follows strangers for material meets a thief who takes him under his wing.

41.name: The Prince of Egypt
41.description: An Egyptian prince learns of his identity as a Hebrew and his destiny to become the chosen deliverer of his people.

42.name: Fallen
42.description: Homicide detective John Hobbes witnesses the execution of serial killer Edgar Reese. Soon after the execution the killings start again, and they are very similar to Reese's style.

43.name: Small Soldiers
43.description: When missile technology is used to enhance toy action figures, the toys soon begin to take their battle programming too seriously.

44.name: Rushmore
44.description: The extracurricular king of Rushmore Preparatory School is put on academic probation.

45.name: What Dreams May Come
45.description: Chris Nielsen dies in a night car crash and goes to Heaven. When time later his wife and recently widow Annie commits suicide unable to overcome the loss, he will descents Hell to save her.

46.name: Enemy of the State
46.description: A lawyer becomes a target by a corrupt politician and his N.S.A. goons when he accidentally receives key evidence to a serious politically motivated crime.

47.name: Lost in Space
47.description: The Robinson family was going into space to fight for a chance for humanity. Now they are fighting to live long enough to find a way home.

48.name: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later
48.description: Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time, as the life of her own son hangs in the balance.

49.name: Patch Adams
49.description: The true story of a heroic man, Hunter "Patch" Adams, determined to become a medical doctor because he enjoys helping people. He ventured where no doctor had ventured before, using humour and pathos.

50.name: U.S. Marshals
50.description: U.S. Marshal Samuel Gerard and his team of Marshals are assigned to track down Sheridan, who has been accused of a double-murder.
